text: is a former Japanese football player. She played for the Japan national team. Her father Mamoru Morimoto is former middle distance runner. ==Biography== Morimoto was born on November 9, 1970. She played for Nissan FC. However, the club was disbanded in 1993. After she left the club, she played for Nikko Securities Dream Ladies and the Ladies side of Italian Serie A club Lazio. On August 21, 1994, Morimoto debuted and scored a goal for the Japan national team against Austria. She was a member of Japan for 1995 World Cup. She also played at 1994 Asian Games and 1995 AFC Championship. She played 5 games and scored 1 goal for Japan until 1995. ==Statistics== Japan Football Association Japan national team Year Apps Goals 1994 4 1 1995 1 0 Total 5 1 ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1970 births Category:Living people Category:Japanese footballers Category:Japan women's international footballers Category:Nadeshiko League players Category:Nissan FC Ladies players Category:Nikko Securities Dream Ladies players Category:1995 FIFA Women's World Cup players Category:1995 AFC Women's Championship players Category:Footballers at the 1994 Asian Games Category:Asian Games medalists in football Category:Asian Games silver medalists for Japan Category:Medalists at the 1994 Asian Games
title: Tsuru Morimoto
